title: Carney Speech on U.S. ‘Rupture’ and Canada’s Survival Draws Standing Ovation at Davos
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney got a standing ovation in Davos for starkly describing the end of Pax Americana. He is looking for new allies to help his country survive it.

title: Air Force One Turns Back With Trump After Electrical Issue
summary: The plane was heading for Switzerland when it turned back for Joint Base Andrews. A White House official said there had been a minor electrical issue.

title: Canada’s Leader Warns of a ‘Rupture’ in the Global Order, and ICE Is Accused of Killing Detainee
summary: Plus, what’s the point of learning cursive?

title: Supreme Court Considers Trump’s Attempt to Fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook
summary: The justices deferred a decision on the president’s efforts to oust Cook, agreeing to hear arguments on Wednesday instead.

title: Supreme Court to Weigh Trump’s Bid to Fire Lisa Cook
summary: The Supreme Court is hearing oral arguments on Wednesday in the case of Lisa Cook, the Federal Reserve governor whom President Trump is trying to fire. Our reporter Colby Smith describes the importance of Cook’s case for the independence of the central bank.

title: California Republicans Ask Supreme Court to Block New Congressional Map
summary: Republicans asked the justices to step in after a federal court rejected their claims that the state’s new congressional map violated the Constitution.

title: What’s a Human Life Worth? The E.P.A. Says Zero Dollars.
summary: The Environmental Protection Agency has stopped estimating the dollar value of lives saved in the cost-benefit analyses for new pollution rules.

title: Inside Trump’s Campaign to Tame Higher Education
summary: Donald J. Trump has unleashed the power of the presidency against American colleges, with mixed results.

title: Halligan Leaves as U.S. Attorney After Mounting Pressure From Judges
summary: For weeks, judges have pressed Ms. Halligan to explain why she continues to identify herself in court filings as the U.S. attorney, despite a ruling in November that she was unlawfully appointed to the job.

title: Cubans in Florida Are Being Deported in Record Numbers
summary: Cubans had long benefited from legal privileges unavailable to immigrants from other countries. President Trump has changed that.

title: In Court Record, Official Describes Assault Before ICE Agent Shot Man in Minneapolis
summary: The agent told an investigator that he was assaulted with a broom and a shovel before he fired a single shot that wounded a Venezuelan man.

title: ChongLy Scott Thao, Hmong Immigrant and U.S. Citizen, Arrested by ICE
summary: A Hmong immigrant, who is a U.S. citizen, was released after being questioned for an hour. Federal officials said they had been seeking sex offenders.

title: Taiwan’s $40 Billion Military Spending Plan Stalled by Political Impasse
summary: Taiwan’s domestic gridlock is revealing a deep-seated fracture over how the island should defend itself and how much it can depend on the United States.

title: Majority of Latin Americans Endorsed Trump’s Intervention In Venezuela, Polls Show
summary: Several polls show that a majority of Latin Americans who were questioned endorsed the intervention, suggesting a shift, at least for now, from ideology to pragmatism.

title: House Foreign Affairs Members Call for Machado to Govern Venezuela
summary: The Venezuelan opposition leader stressed the need for free elections in her latest bipartisan meeting with lawmakers.

title: Uber Faces Growing Pressure Over Sexual Assault Record
summary: From the ballot box in California to the halls of Congress and Wall Street, several new initiatives would require more oversight of how the company protects its passengers.

title: An Anxious Japan Restarts the World’s Biggest Nuclear Plant
summary: Japan is reviving nuclear power, balancing the need for more clean energy against the lingering trauma of the 2011 Fukushima Daiichi disaster.

title: What ‘Marty Supreme’ Says About Being Jewish in America
summary: The film’s unapologetic depiction of the experience in all of its complications rejects the idea that such characters have to suffer.

title: What to Know About Brooklyn Beckham’s Accusations Against His Parents
summary: On Monday, the eldest Beckham son posted one-sided explosive accusations against his parents on Instagram. His parents have not responded directly.

title: Trump’s Politics Are Not America First. They’re Me First.
summary: Donald Trump is the most un-American president in our history. And in his second term, there is no one to constrain his un-American impulses.

title: You Can’t Denaturalize Me
summary: Is purging America of immigrants so crucial that in the process you must unmake America itself?

title: Trump 2.0
summary: We look at the first year of the president’s second term.

title: Late Night Cringes Over Trump’s Texting Spree
summary: Jimmy Kimmel quipped that the president “can do so much damage in one three-day weekend — I don’t know if anybody has ever done more.”

title: Man Gets Life in Prison for Killing Shinzo Abe, Former Leader of Japan
summary: Tetsuya Yamagami, 45, had admitted to shooting Mr. Abe, Japan’s longest-serving prime minister; but his case divided Japan.

title: Despite Drastic Financial Steps, Met Opera Turns to Layoffs and Cuts
summary: The largest performing arts organization in the country will lay off workers, cut salaries and reduce its offerings. It may also sell its Chagall murals that are valued at $55 million.

title: Miami Beach Nightclub Is Condemned for Playing Kanye West’s Song ‘Heil Hitler’
summary: The club, Vendôme, was hosting several right-wing influencers, including Andrew and Tristan Tate, the brothers who are being investigated in Europe in connection with human trafficking.

title: Forecasters Warn of a Major Storm Brewing for the South
summary: One meteorologist warns that “the main ingredients” are fitting into place for a disruptive winter storm later this week.
